name: Weyland Security Division
description: Pretty standard big ice & econ tag and bag. Trying out Off the Grid w/ DRT & Data Raven.

name: Parasital Nightmare v3
description:
The third iteration substitutes two Nerve Agents for one Femme Fatal and one Liberated Accounts.
I have playtested this renewed deck quite intensively this weekend and had some nice successes against a large variety of Corp-factions.

What you aim for is usually an early Wyldside, an early Personal Workshop as well as some economy cards, such as Sure Gamble, Liberated Accounts, Dirty Laundry or Daily Casts. A nice way to open the match is Sure Gamble + cheap Virus (best is Datasucker) + Dirty Laundry on Archives, which happens rather often. Brings quite a lot of credits and with a little luck the first agenda.

What really works surprisingly well, are sudden R&D rushes, usually initiated by a Stimhack in order to have enough credits to install Mediums from Personal Workshop or Clone Chips, as well as the for the installation of Parasites and usage of Wyrm to destroy ICE.
The then unprotected R&D can be dug deeply. Apart from Agendas it is also absolutely annoying for the Corp if you destroy ICE with Imp-tokens.

Currently I am really satisfied with the mechanics this deck provides. Though I am considering including some New Angeles City Halls in order to be protected against Sea Source/Posted Bounty +Scorched Earth or Breaking News + Closed Accounts, as especially the latter is a pain in the ass. Also it allows last-click-runs against potential Snares.
I wouldn't know, though, which cards to drop out. Maybe just increase deck size to 48. A resource-tutor would be amazing, but completely overpowered in this deck :)

name: Off the grid vHJ.1
description:
My idea for an OtG deck. Corporate troubleshooter to make sure the runner can't get in when you need to keep him out. Extra nice if you can use it on an Archer. :)
Minelayer to help with instal costs on HQ. Ice up archives as well, especially vs criminal and keep a CTS for archives vs a sneakdoor beta. Everything else is money. Simple, effectiveness to be determined. :)

name: OmNBNiscience
description:
This deck is intended to be thematically appealing, rather than competitive. I like the idea of NBN as an all-seeing corp, always knowing where the runner is. So, I made the deck trace/tag heavy, with tag punish like Closed Accounts/Big Brother/Muckraker.

Any suggestions are welcome and appreciated.
